The CEO's private memo was signed with an unusually small RSA exponent. Can you recover the original message from the signature 0x663c4e94b5755757debf867efdf0f4ace1c8d21bc5a8d63970a7ae13e3075d1942816a9b258fac1875619dabf3eab313094df8530ca292c034d399853c1ae936?

Public Key (n, e): (6468886453539289526614108562503194726105341892459615497257018733222339383296975015727474466701208968673124881091362901889192709760379927263547577957568973, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{kivoojop}
ciphertext: 0x663c4e94b5755757debf867efdf0f4ace1c8d21bc5a8d63970a7ae13e3075d1942816a9b258fac1875619dabf3eab313094df8530ca292c034d399853c1ae936
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (6468886453539289526614108562503194726105341892459615497257018733222339383296975015727474466701208968673124881091362901889192709760379927263547577957568973, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
